Grammatical tagsets defined in the TEI

Table of contents

  • 1. Sample 01: tagsets in taxonomies
  • 2. Examples of inline annotation

1. Sample 01: tagsets in taxonomies

This document demonstrates setting up tagsets by using the mechanism of taxonomy declarations in the TEI header.

One immediate consequence that can be noticed is that feature values must receive compound values, the first part of which acts as the namespace, hence "STTS" or "UD", etc. as the prefix.

Another important consequence is that, since feature values are set up as IDs, they have to obey XML restrictions on IDs, and in particular, they may not contain commas or brackets -- compare the last symbols for punctuation in STTS, where I needed to use the full names ("sttsInternalPunctuation" instead of "$("). Farewell short tags...

As far as the category level of tagset definition is concerned, it offers only limited documentation options, basically via <desc> . <catDesc> is not allowed if the <equiv> elements are to be used. Note by the way that adding <catDesc> to the att.datcat class, and then it could use the datcat attribute (an issue debated for this class of elements back in 2012).

2. Examples of inline annotation
